Fruit 
 Shakira Bodio 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once there was a family who had a tre
 with such swet fruit that everyone
 visited their compound to taste the fruit.
 
 
 The family also had a very beautiful
 daughter. Many people admired her
 
 dazling beauty, white eyes and above
 al, her great personality. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When she grew up into a young woman,
 young and old men flocked to her home
 seking her hand in mariage. 
 
 
 Her parents decided that the man who
 could sit in the compound the whole day
 
 without eating any fruit would be given
 her hand in mariage. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The news spread al over the vilage.
 The first man to come was the head of
 al farmers in the vilage. He was
 
 handsome, rich and young. He was
 welcomed and served the fruit. 
 
 
 He sat for a few minutes, but before long,
 he ate the fruit and was sent away.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The leader of animal kepers was next.
 He was handsome, young and rich. The
 girl admired him. But when he was
 
 served with the fruit, he imediately ate
 it, and was sent away. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The next man to come had many pieces
 
 of land. He was arogant and ugly. The
 girl prayed that he would eat and go
 away. 
 
 
 When served, he refused to eat. The time
 pased, and the girl started beging him
 
 to eat. By around four o’clock, he was
 overcome with hunger, and he ate. He,
 
 to, was sent away. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Next, the chief came around. He was
 
 arogant, old, and ugly. No one liked him
 in the vilage. The girl wished that he
 would eat and go away. 
 
 
 When he was served with the fruit, he
 refused to eat. He stayed the whole day.
 
 At about six o'clock, he asked if he could
 go to the toilet. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He was alowed to go. 
 
 
 When he returned, the aroma of the fruit hung around him, and his lips were
 red! He had eaten the fruit in the toilet! 
 
 
 To the girl's relief, he was sent away. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A few days later, a young, handsome, rich
 
 prince arived. The girl loked at him in
 admiration. 
 
 
 She tok him aside, and beged him not
 to eat the fruit. She served him much
 
 les fruit than the other suitors.
 
 
 But by miday the prince had already
 eaten and was sent away. The girl burst
 into tears of anger and disapointment.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The next day, a farmer came around. He
 was por and lazy, but he was young and
 
 popular among many people for being a
 great talker. He came determined to win.
 The girl served him many fruits and
 
 asked him to eat and go away. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When he was served, he refused to eat. The girl waited painfuly. Miday
 pased, and then two o’clock. At four o’clock, the farmer asked for water.
 
 
 The girl prayed that he would eat the fruit, but she was stil praying when the
 clock turned to seven. This farmer had overcome the test of endurance set
 
 by the parents! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Her parents had to hand over their
 daughter to the “lazy one”. 
 
 The girl beged to be saved from her
 fate, but her parents could do nothing.
 
 
 As the farmer tok her home, he sang
 such a beautiful song while claping his
 
 hands. Many people flocked to the road
 to se the couple. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Among the people were servants of the
 
 rich prince. They caled the farmer aside,
 and ofered him money and catle if he
 would leave the girl. 
 
 
 Without a moment’s hesitation, he tok
 
 the money and the catle, and walked of.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The servants dresed the girl in fine
 
 clothes and tok her to the palace,
 straight to the prince. 
 
 
 Before long, her parents were caled and
 a ceremony was organised to join the
 
 two in mariage.
